result.execSummary:
The defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Same conditions as probation, exception is condition time.
*To commence after the period of revocation has been served.

*5/23/2016 Honorable Mark Sanders.  Order signed.  probation term commuted to three (3) years.
*06-28-2017 - Order granting defendant to travel to Mexico from August 20 to September 11, 2017 and Court further ordered defendant to continue to comply with all conditions of his probation and to report to his agent upon his return.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay a fine of $2,400  PLUS all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge and ignition interlock surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Court sets Restitution in the amount of $24
*Pay Restitution in the amount of $24 to the Oak Creek Police Dept. during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
*If confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

*Court sets Restitution in the amount of $24
*Pay Restitution in the amount of $24 to the Oak Creek Police Dept. during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Alcohol assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random screens. Breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes:
*Straight Time. Forthwith.
**09-13-16/Order allowing Good Time Credit.

MOTION FOR GOOD TIME CREDIT, FILED

The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is denied.  The court intended the defendant to serve the condition time without release privileges. (i.e. "straight time"). - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. spc
Motion for Work Search and Huber Privileges.
Restitution refund packet. DZ
Order Commuting Probation Term, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. spc
Letter from DOC requesting review of defendant's sentence.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State and defense counsel.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  54  months with  5  days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  30 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24 months.  
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  42  months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 12 months in the House of Correction, straight time.  Condition time to commence forthwith.
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  Breathalyzers
-  No illegal substances
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment
-  Pay a fine of $2,400  PLUS all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge and ignition interlock surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $24
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $24 to the Oak Creek Police Dept. during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  Breathalyzers
-  No illegal substances
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment
-  Pay a fine of $2,400  PLUS all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge and ignition interlock surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $24
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $24 to the Oak Creek Police Dept. during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
if confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Court ordered Alcohol Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for  36  months.   
Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of  36 months to commence after the period of revocation has been served.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia in court with Attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There are offer issues; parties are still trying to settle.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in treatment.  Defendant's previous request for leave to attend a family reunion in Mexico from 8-22-2015 to 8-29-2015 is granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Blood test results have not been received.  Defendant also requests permission to travel to Mexico from August 22nd to August 29th for a family reunion.  Court will hold off his decision until next court appearance.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held off the record. Defense counsel requested more time to review the case and the State is requesting more time as it awaits for blood results. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report received and filed.

Defendant Abelardo Ruiz Garcia in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Joanne Hardtke for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 6/16/15.

NO DRIVING DURING PENDENCY OF THIS CASE.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.
